name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: [SOUND] This lecture is about

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: the Evaluation of Text Categorization.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So we've talked about many different methods for text categorization.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: But how do you know which method works better?

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And for a particular application

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: how do you know this is the best way of solving your problem?

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _To understand these
column6: we have to _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: how to we have to know how to evaluate categorization results.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So first some general thoughts about the evaluation.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _In general
column6: for evaluation of this kind of empirical tasks such as categorization

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: we use methodology that was developed in 1960s by

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: information retrieval researchers.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: Called a Cranfield Evaluation Methodology.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _The basic idea is to have humans create test correction

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _where
column6: we already know
column7: every document is tagged with the desired categories. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Or
column6: in the case of search

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _been retrieved
column6: and this is called

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Now
column6: with this ground truth test correction

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: we can then reuse the collection to test the many different systems and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: then compare different systems.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: We can also turn off some components in the system to see what's going to happen.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: Basically it provides a way to do control experiments to compare different methods.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So this methodology has been virtually used for

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: all the tasks that involve empirically defined problems.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So in our case
column6: then
column7: we are going to compare our systems categorization _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _results with the categorization
column6: ground truth

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And we're going to compare our systems decisions

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: which documents should get which category with what

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: categories have been assigned to those documents by humans.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And we want to quantify the similarity of these decisions or

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _equivalently
column6: to measure the difference between the system output and _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: the desired ideal output generated by the humans.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So obviously
column6: the highest similarity is the better results are. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: The similarity could be measured in different ways.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And that would lead to different measures.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And sometimes it's desirable also to match the similarity from different perspectives

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: just to have a better understanding of the results in detail.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _For example
column6: we might be also interested in knowing which category performs _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _better and which which category is easy to categorize
column6: etc. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _In general
column6: different categorization mistakes _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _however
column6: have different costs for specific applications. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So some areas might be more serious than others.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So ideally
column6: we would like to model such differences

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: many papers in categorization you will see that they don't generally do that.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Instead
column6: they will use a simplified measure and that's because it's _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: often okay not to consider such a cost variation when we compare methods and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: when we are interested in knowing the relative difference of these methods.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So it's okay to introduce some bias
column6: as long as the bias is not already with _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: a particular method and then we should expect the more effective method to

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _perform better than a less effective one
column6: even though the measure is not perfect. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So the first measure that we'll introduce is called classification accuracy and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: this is a basic into measure the percentage of correct decisions.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So here you see that there are categories denoted by c1

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _through ck and there are n documents
column6: denoted by d1 through d N. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And for each pair of category and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _the document
column6: we can then look at the situation. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And see if the system has said yes to this pair

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: basically has assigned this category to this document.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Or no
column6: so this is denoted by Y or M
column7: that's the systems of the decision. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And similarly
column6: we can look at the human's decisions also

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: a category to the document of that there will be a plus sign here.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: That just means that a human.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: We think of this assignment is correct and incorrect then it's a minus.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So we'll see all combinations of this Ns
column6: yes and nos

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: There are four combinations in total.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And two of them are correct
column6: and that's when we have y(+) or n(-)

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: and then there are also two kinds of errors.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So the measure of classification accuracy is simply to count

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: how many of these decisions are correct.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And normalize that by the total number of decisions we have made.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So
column6: we know that the total number of decisions is n

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And
column6: the number of correct decisions are basically of two kinds. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: One is y plusses.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And the other is n minus this n.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: We just put together the count.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Now
column6: this is a very convenient measure that will give us one number _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: to characterize performance of a method.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And the higher
column6: the better

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: But the method also has some problems.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: First it has treated all the decisions equally.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _But in reality
column6: some decision errors are more serious than others. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _For example
column6: it may be more important to get the decisions right on some documents

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: than others.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Or maybe
column6: more important to get the decisions right on some categories

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _than others
column6: and this would call for _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: some detailed evaluation of this results to understand the strands and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _of different methods
column6: and to understand the performance of these methods. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: In detail in a per category or

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: per document basis.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: One example that shows clearly the decision errors are having different

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: causes is spam filtering that could be retrieved as two category categorization

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: problem.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Missing a legitimate email result
column6: is one type of error. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: But letting spam to come into your folder is another type of error.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _The two types of errors are clearly very different

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: because it's very important not to miss a legitimate email.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: It's okay to occasionally let a spam email to come into your inbox.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So the error of the first
column6: missing a legitimate email is very

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: It's a very serious mistake and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _classification error
column6: classification accuracy does not address this issue. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: There's also another problem with imbalance to test set.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: Imagine there's a skew to test set where most instances are category one and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: 98% of instances are category one.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: Only 2% are in category two.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _In such a case
column6: we can have a very simple baseline that accurately performs _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: very well and that baseline.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Sign with similar
column6: I put all instances in the major category. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: That will get us 98% accuracy in this case.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _It's going to be appearing to be very effective
column6: but in reality

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: this is obviously not a good result.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And so
column6: in general
column7: when we use classification accuracy as a measure

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: we want to ensure that the causes of balance.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And one above equal number of instances
column6: for _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: example in each class the minority categories or causes tend to be

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: overlooked in the evaluation of classification accuracy.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So
column6: to address these problems
column7: we of course would like to also evaluate _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: the results in other ways and in different ways.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _As I said
column6: it's beneficial to look at after multiple perspectives. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So for example
column6: we can look at the perspective from each document _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: as a perspective based on each document.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So the question here is
column6: how good are the decisions on this document? _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Now
column6: as in the general cases of all decisions

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _combinations of possibilities
column6: depending on whether the system has said yes and _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: depending on whether the human has said it correct or incorrect or said yes or no.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And so the four combinations are first when both the human systems said yes
column6: and _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _that's the true positives
column6: when the system says

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So
column6: when the system says

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _But
column6: when the human confirm that it is indeed correct

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: that becomes a true positive.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _When the system says
column6: yes

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _that's incorrect
column6: that's a false positive

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And when the system says no
column6: but the human says yes

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: We missed one assignment.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: When both the system and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _human says no
column6: then it's also correctly to assume that's true negatives. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _All right
column6: so then we can have some measures to just _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: better characterize the performance by using these four numbers and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: so two popular measures are precision and recall.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And these were also proposed by information retrieval researchers 1960s

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _for evaluating search results
column6: but _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _now they have become standard measures
column6: use it everywhere. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So when the system says yes
column6: we can ask the question

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: What's the percent of correct decisions when the system says yes?

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: That's called precision.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _It's true positive divided by all the cases when the system says yes

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: all the positives.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _The other measure is called recall
column6: and this measures _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: whether the document has all the categories it should have.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So in this case it's divide the true positive by true positives and

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: the false negatives.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: So these are all the cases where

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: this human Says the document should have this category.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So this represents both categories that it should have got
column6: and _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: so recall tells us whether the system has actually indeed

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: assigned all the categories that it should have to this document.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _This gives us a detailed view of the document

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: then we can aggregate them later.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And if we're interested in some documents
column6: and _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _this will tell us how well we did on those documents
column6: the subsets of them. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _It might be more interesting than others
column6: for example. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And this allows us to analyze errors in more detail as well.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _We can separate the documents of certain characteristics from others
column6: and _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: then look at the errors.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _You might see a pattern A for this kind of document
column6: this long document. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: It doesn't as well for shock documents.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And this gives you some insight for inputting the method.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Similarly
column6: we can look at the per-category evaluation. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _In this case

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: we're going to look at the how good are the decisions on a particular category.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: As in the previous case we can define precision and recall.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And it would just basically answer the questions from a different perspective.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So when the system says yes
column6: how many are correct? _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: That means looking at this category to see if all the documents

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _that are assigned with this category are indeed in this category
column6: right? _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And recall
column6: would tell us
column7: has the category been actually assigned to _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: all the documents That should have this category.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _It's sometimes also useful to combine precision and recall as one measure
column6: and _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: this is often done by using f measure.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And this is just a harmonic mean of precision.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: Precision and recall defined on this slide.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And it's also controlled by a parameter beta to

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: indicate whether precision is more important or recall is more.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _When beta is set to 1
column6: we have measure called F1

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _in this case
column6: we just take equal weight upon both procedure and recall. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: F1 is very often used as a measure for categorization.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Now
column6: as in all cases

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _the best way of combining them
column6: so in this case I don't know if you have thought _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _about it and we could have combined them just with arithmetic mean
column6: right. _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _So that would still give us the same range of values
column6: but _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _obviously there's a reason why we didn't do that and why f1 is more popular

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: and it's actually useful to think about difference.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And we think about that
column6: you'll see that there is indeed some difference and _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: some undesirable property of this arithmatic.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Basically
column6: it will be obvious to you if you think about a case _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: when the system says yes for all the category and document pairs.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And then try the compute the precision and recall in that case.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: And see what would happen.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _And basically
column6: this kind of measure

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _the arithmetic mean
column6: is not going to be as _

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _reasonable as F1 minus one [INAUDIBLE] trade off

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: so that the two values are equal.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: There is an extreme case where you have 0 for one letter and one for the other.

name: 4 - 12 - 3.12 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 1 (00-14-12).srt
text: _Then F1 will be low
column6: but the mean would still be reasonably high. _
